PerkinElmer is looking for a Senior UX Designer

About you:
You have a curious nature and keep abreast of new developments or ideas gaining momentum in the business. You are a talented UX Designer looking to create industry leading and intuitive user experiences. You possess strong user focus and are a usability research advocate . You have an eye for clean and artful design, possess superior UX skills, and be able to translate high-level and detailed requirements into smart, functional user interfaces. You love to produce delightful user experiences in every single product you touch.
You enjoy collaborat ing continuously with Users, Product Management, Engineering, and other stakeholders using design thinking and other UX techniques to solve complex problems . Most of all, you want to work on software experiences that contribute to making people’s li f e and health better and make a difference .

Getting to know your team and the people involved

Gaining a basic understanding of the problem space

Designing some features that will go directly into a shipping software product

Develop prototypes, screenshots, wireframes -- whatever gets the job done

Refine other people's ideas and come up with your own

Participate and collaborate in concept development and design ideation for new product features.

Quickly and thoughtfully incorporate team feedback into designs

Produce compelling, engaging, user experiences that allow users to accomplish their tasks easily and efficiently

Create and validate hypotheses regarding what we can build to solve user problems

Get c omfortable conducting or working with UX research to validate designs with end users

Incorporate and contribute to our internal design guidelines, ensuring consistency across the entire product

Within 90 days -

Be a partner with Product Management and your team to define the vision for the product

Lead and apply different methods of design thinking to understand and solve for problem spaces along different phases of a project, working directly with product owners and tech leads

Collaborate with Product Management to understand product requirements and turn them into buildable user experiences, balancing design scope to address usability and engineering concerns with release timelines.

Mentor and work closely with more junior level designers to offer feedback and production support

Contribute to coordination of design systems and documentation of UX best practices

Self-driven, curious, collaborative , and a good communicator

Excellent visual design skills.
Proficient with standard design software such as Adobe XD, Figma, Sketch.
Professional written communication and interpersonal skills.

Proactive with a bias for action, pushing for clarity around ambiguous problems.

Experiencing designing for games.

Experience developing/creating design libraries.
Experience working in an Agile/Scrum development process.

About The Brand: Pluto TV, a ViacomCBS company, is the leading free streaming television service in America, delivering 250+ live and original channels and thousands of on-demand movies in partnership with major TV networks, movie studios, publishers, and digital media companies. Pluto TV is available on all mobile, web and connected TV streaming devices and millions of viewers tune in each month to watch premium news, TV shows, movies, sports, lifestyle, and trending digital series. Headquartered in West Hollywood, Pluto TV has offices in New York, Silicon Valley, Chicago and Berlin. Overview and Responsibilities:
Pluto TV's UX and Product Design team is currently looking for a Senior UX Designer to join the team. This person will be owning the design of features for various platforms that host the Pluto TV service in order to improve user engagement and retention.
The role will report to the Senior Director of Product Design.
Responsibilities
This is a meaningful role with a wide range of responsibilities, including:
Lead the design of cross-platform features while collaborating with platform specific teams for implementation and iterative improvements.
Break down complex problems to find the discrete and actionable solutions required for our agile product organisation.
Communicate the user experience at various stages of the design process, in person and asynchronously, through wireframes, flow diagrams, storyboards, mockups, and/or high fidelity prototypes, and task tracking tools.
Make evidence based arguments for problem definitions and solutions.
Inform success metrics for design solutions.
Basic Qualifications:
We believe these are the key requirements to be successful:
At least 5 years of commercial product designer experience as part of a design team with a high degree of autonomy while working closely with product and design teams to solve complex problems.
Ability to effectively define and delegate tasks to UI designers.
Experience with collaborative Lean UX frameworks.
Experience creating and synthesizing unmoderated usability tests.
Demonstrated success using design systems across multiple platforms.
Record of influencing successful high-profile, highly-visible information architecture decisions.
Experience making significant contributions creating multivariate tests to inform or validate features.
Fluent with Qualitative and Quantitative User Data.
